title: Sonic Adventure remake rumours boosted by Welcome to Station Square music remix
text:
Could Sega be building up to a remake of Sonic Adventure?

Sega has released the first of four official remixes of tunes from Sonic Adventure, leading fans to start speculating about a full remake.

It says a lot about the current state of Sonic The Hedgehog at the moment that this remix of a tune from Sonic Adventure is probably the best thing to happen to the franchise since Sonic Mania.

The track Welcome to Station Square played in the hub world area from Sonic Adventure, which was first released for the Dreamcast in 1998 and still remains one of the best ever 3D Sonic games – although that says more about the other rivals for the crown than it does about Sonic Adventure.

The remix is by Tee Lopes, who worked on the soundtracks for Sonic Mania and Team Sonic Racing, and who is joined by Sonic Adventure sound director Jun Senoue on guitar.

The Sonic The Hedgehog Twitter account mentions this as being the first of four new remixes, while Lopes has made a point of referring to the remix as ‘official’.

All of which has led fans to speculate on whether this might all be leading up to a full remake of the original game.

Sega does occasionally remaster Dreamcast games, such as the recent Shenmue I & II compendium, but the outdated controls and camera system of Sonic Adventure does seem like it would require a remake from the ground up.

Who Sega would get to do that is impossible to guess at but there are currently no Sonic The Hedgehog games scheduled for release at the moment and that’s unusual, especially given the movie coming out next year – which even if it’s terrible will still raise the profile of the franchise well beyond its usual levels.

Series producer Takashi Iizuka has said there’s a new mainline Sonic game currently in development but nothing has been revealed about it and that certainly wouldn’t rule out a remake as well.
